unnormalised: **New Traffic Regulations Aim to Boost Road Safety, Reduce Congestion**
normalised: **New Traffic Regulations Aim to Boost Road Safety, Reduce Congestion**

unnormalised: Mumbai, Maharashtra - Effective November 1st, new traffic regulations are being implemented across major Indian cities, focusing on improved road safety and reduced congestion. The Ministry of Road Transport and Highways, inspired by studies from IIT Bombay, has announced stricter penalties for common offenses.
normalised: Mumbai, Maharashtra - Effective November first, new traffic regulations are being implemented across major Indian cities, focusing on improved road safety and reduced congestion. The Ministry of Road Transport and Highways, inspired by studies from I I T Bombay, has announced stricter penalties for common offenses.

unnormalised: Expect increased enforcement of lane discipline, particularly on highways like the Mumbai-Pune Expressway. A new rule prohibits honking within 100 meters of hospitals and educational institutions, carrying a fine of Rs. 2000. Speed limits on expressways have been revised based on vehicle type; cars are capped at 120 km/h, while commercial vehicles are limited to 80 km/h.
normalised: Expect increased enforcement of lane discipline, particularly on highways like the Mumbai-Pune Expressway. A new rule prohibits honking within one hundred meters of hospitals and educational institutions, carrying a fine of rupee two thousand. Speed limits on expressways have been revised based on vehicle type; cars are capped at one hundred and twenty kilometer per hour, while commercial vehicles are limited to eighty kilometer per hour.

unnormalised: Authorities are also cracking down on overloaded vehicles, a significant contributor to accidents. Remember the iconic scene from 'Deewar'? Don’t try to be a 'coolie' overloading your trucks; it’s dangerous and now heavily penalized. These changes aim to foster a more responsible driving culture and significantly improve road safety statistics nationwide. The regulations also mandate reflective tape on all commercial vehicles for better visibility at night.
